title: AB 1175
content: The State of California enacts the following. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code in California sets fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and service contractors. The initial registration fee is $205 for each place of business for electronic and appliance repair dealers, and $95 for service contractors. The initial registration fee for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers in California is $405 per place of business for those engaging in both industries, and $300 per place of business for service contractors who are involved in either industry. The registration fee for service dealers in the electronic and appliance repair industry in California is not more than $500 per place of business. Service dealers or contractors without a physical location in the state must still pay the registration fee as if they had a place of business in California. The annual registration renewal fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers in California are as follows: $205 for each place of business for electronic or appliance repair service dealers, $95 for service contractors, and $400 for service dealers engaging in both industries. The annual renewal fee for a service dealer in California who engages in electronic and appliance repair industries is $475 per place of business. Service dealers or contractors without a physical location in the state must pay the registration fee as if they had a place of business. The delinquency fee is 50 percent of the renewal fee for a license, with exceptions. This section is effective until January 1, 2019, unless extended by a later statute. The director cannot increase any fee in this section before January 1, 2017. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code is being amended. The director sets fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers. Initial registration fee is $205 per place of business, or $405 for both types of dealers. The annual registration renewal fee for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers is $205 per place of business, or $400 for both types of dealers. A delinquency fee of 50% of the renewal fee applies. This section becomes effective on January 1, 2019. The fee for various licenses under the Business and Professions Code will be set by the chief with approval from the director, ranging from $80 to $940. This section becomes effective on January 1, 2019. Individuals making pillows, quilts, quilted pads, or comforters in their own homes are exempt from license fees, but must comply with all other provisions of the chapter. Retailers selling "used" and "antique" furniture are exempt from fee requirements and other provisions of the chapter. Those selling upholstered furniture and bedding must comply with fee requirements. A person licensed as an upholstered furniture and bedding manufacturer or custom upholsterer does not need to pay an additional fee for a sanitizer's license.
